stack writes:
> Does the URL http://www.hicourt.gov.cn/law/newlaw.asp?da=3 trigger a 
> midfetch abort?

It shouldn't:

tiphares (1)% wget -S 'http://www.hicourt.gov.cn/law/newlaw.asp?da=3'
--14:46:05--  http://www.hicourt.gov.cn/law/newlaw.asp?da=3
           => `newlaw.asp?da=3'
Resolving www.hicourt.gov.cn... done.
Connecting to www.hicourt.gov.cn[202.100.222.198]:80... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 
 1 HTTP/1.1 200 OK
 2 Server: Microsoft-IIS/5.0
 3 Date: Tue, 21 Dec 2004 19:48:13 GMT
 4 Connection: keep-alive
 5 Connection: Keep-Alive
 6 Content-Length: 21867
 7 Content-Type: text/html
 8 Set-Cookie: ASPSESSIONIDCAAQBRSQ=OFCFGJDAGKMOMLJBKPLMEIOJ; path=/
 9 Cache-control: private

It's possible that things timed out --- connections to the PRC (where
all of the sites in this crawl are located) are pretty slow of late.
